CARDINAL . The applicant paid the fine and appealed on points of law . He submitted , inter alia , that the appellate court had interpreted LAW erroneously when it considered that the offence was made out even where a person claimed to be a minister of a “ known religion ” without , however , discharging any of the functions of the minister ’s office . CARDINAL . LAW GPE and others , on the one hand , and GPE , on the other , which was concluded on CARDINAL DATE and ratified by the NORP parliament by a law published in ORG on DATE , provides as follows :
( Translation )
“ The life , property , honour , religion and customs of the inhabitants of the districts ceded to GPE who will remain under NORP administration shall be scrupulously respected .
They shall enjoy in full the same civil and political rights as the subjects of NORP origin . NORP shall be entitled to freedom and to practise their religion openly .
There shall be no interference with the autonomy or hierarchical organisation of existing or future NORP communities or in the management of their funds or property .
Each mufti shall be elected by NORP voters in his own constituency .

In addition to their authority in purely religious matters and in the supervision of the management of vacouf property , the muftis shall have jurisdiction as between NORP in the spheres of marriage , divorce , maintenance ( nefaca ) , guardianship , administration , capacity of minors , NORP wills and succession to the office of mutevelli ( PERSON ) .
Judgments delivered by the muftis shall be enforced by the competent NORP authorities .

As regards successions , any interested NORP party may with prior agreement submit a dispute to the mufti as arbitrator . Unless the agreement expressly provides otherwise , all avenues of appeal to the NORP courts shall lie against an arbitral award . ”

CARDINAL . Ministers of ORG and other “ known religions ” enjoy a number of privileges under domestic law . Inter alia , the religious weddings they celebrate produce the same legal effects as civil weddings and they are exempt from military service .
